generationModele

Class Norm

  • java.lang.Object
    • generationModele.Norm

  • public class Norm
extends java.lang.Object
    Norm is a class which represents an norm.

    A norm consists of :

    • A name which is assigned at its creation.
    • A institution mother which is assigned at its creation.
    • A list of institutional paramaters.
    • A list of environnemental paramaters.

    It's possible to add parameters to or remove parameters from a norm with constraints .

      • addParameter

        public void addParameter(java.lang.String type,
                Parameter parameter)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Add a parameter to the institutional parameters hashMap or to the environnemental parameters hashMap.
        Parameters:
        type - Specify in which hashMap adding the parameter. Accepted strings : "institutional" or "environnement"
        parameter - The parameter to add.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Raise an exception if the type is different from "institutional" or from "environnement". Raise an exception if the parameter you want to add don't already belong to the Institution mother.
        See Also:
        Parameter
